Issues.Title: Refactor attribute extraction in the template pipeline
Issues.Body:
Refactor attribute extraction into separate phases with more clearly defined responsibilities.
- **phaseAttributeExtraction:** Creates ops representing extracted attributes
- **phaseParseExtractedStyles:** Parses extracted style and class attributes into individual extracted styles and classes
- **phaseConstCollection:** Collates the extracted attributes and populates the const array

This also removes the need to store an `ElementAttributes` object on each `ElementOp` and then later replace it with a `ConstIndex`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Refactor attribute extraction in the template pipeline" (#51258)

Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

service-worker

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

We have an app that uses OpenID to perform a handshaked sign-in via server redirects. 
On our /login call and redirect, the user is sent to the Idp correctly, and can sign-in. When the user is redirected back to our site (`/api/auth/login`), the serviceworker shows an empty 504 screen

Issues.Title: Loosen validator directives selectors
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

forms

### Description

I have created few custom input components which are basically wrappers around other controls, and they could use validators like `[min]`, `[max]`, ... but I noticed that the selectors for `MaxValidator` are `input[type=number][max][formControlName],input[type=number][max][formControl],input[type=number][max][ngModel]` and this prohibits the usage on external components.

### Proposed solution

Changing specific selectors to just `[max][formControlName],[max][formControl],[max][ngModel]` would allow using them everywhere. I have created a custom directive inheriting from the original directive and it works straight out of the box.

### Alternatives considered

None
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Loosen validator directives selectors" (#51248)

Issues.Title: fix(core): handle hydration of view containers for root components
Issues.Body:
For cases when a root component also acts as an anchor node for a ViewContainerRef (for example, when ViewContainerRef is injected in a root component), there is a need to serialize information about the component itself, as well as an LContainer that represents this ViewContainerRef. Effectively, we need to serialize 2 pieces of info: (1) hydration info for the root component itself and (2) hydration info for the ViewContainerRef instance (an LContainer). Each piece of information is included into the hydration data (in the TransferState object) separately, thus we end up with 2 ids. Since we only have 1 root element, we encode both bits of info into a single string: ids are separated by the `|` char (e.g. `10|25`, where `10` is the `ngh` for a component view and 25 is the `ngh` for a root view which holds LContainer).

Previously, we were only including component-related information, thus all the views in the view container remained dehydrated and duplicated (client-rendered from scratch) on the client.

Resolves #51157.

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): restructure i18n extraction builder to allow for application builder support
Issues.Body:
The `extract-i18n` builder code has been restructured in a similar fashion to the `dev-server` builder. This refactor provides the groundwork to add support for the `application` and `browser-esbuild` builders during message extraction.
The webpack related logic has been split into a separate file and is dynamically imported when needed. Additionally the options processing has been moved to a separate file and the `index.ts` now only exports instead of previously containing most of the builder logic.

Issues.Title: Remove unused css during build
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Description

It can be useful to be able to remove unused css styles during build, to reduce the overall size of the build. Our project mini css , for example, is as large as 11Mb due to 3rd party libraries of charts, etc.


### Describe the solution you'd like

Such a feature may be setup in angular.json, with a collection of ignore list:

```json
{
   "dropUnsedStyles": true,
   "keepStyles": ["my-css-decoration"]
}
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered

webpack has such a plugin, needs some adjustments to work with `ng build`.

This is a new variation of the ESBUILD not being signed issue that causes it not work if your company had locked down executables.

Issues.Title: hmr can be broken when using module federation with shared config
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

https://webpack.js.org/concepts/module-federation/#uncaught-error-shared-module-is-not-available-for-eager-consumption

When `@angular/core` is shared with `eager: false`, this will result

```
Uncaught Error: Shared module is not available for eager consumption
```

Issues.Title: Remove regex file type check on fileReplacements
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Description

Currently when we use `fileReplacements` it will check the files for this regex pattern: `\.(([cm]?j|t)sx?|json)$`. I found it out by trying to replace `robots.production.txt` into `robots.txt`.

This is the config that I am using that throws this error:

```json
{
  "replace": "src/robots.txt",
  "with": "src/robots.production.txt"
}
```

The question is: Why limit file types onto this setting? I don't see the benefit and only drawbacks as I have experienced currently.

### Describe the solution you'd like

I would like to remove regex filetype check on `fileReplacements` property.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Only alternative is to run a custom shell script that would do it for me before running `npm run build:production`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Remove regex file type check on fileReplacements" (#25599)

Issues.Title: feat(CdkConnectedOverlay): Add `cdkConnectedOverlayDisposeOnNavigation` as @Input for the directive
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

It would be nice, if `cdkConnectedOverlayDisposeOnNavigation` could be added as @Input parameter for the CdkConnectedOverlay directive.
Adding it could also be a possibility to add other missing properties from the OverlayConfig.

In the following file `...cdk/overlay/overlay-directive.ts` a new input `@Input('cdkConnectedOverlayDisposeOnNavigation') open: boolean = false;` would have to be added and the `private _buildConfig(): OverlayConfig` method would need modifications to support the new input.

### Use Case

Using the `CdkConnectedOverlay` directive with `disposeOnNavigation`. The directive produces a significantly smaller overhead than the overlay.create() solution.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(CdkConnectedOverlay): Add `cdkConnectedOverlayDisposeOnNavigation` as @Input for the directive" (#27545)
